::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

Calculez la concentration d'une solution de $\ce{Ca(OH)2}$ de pH = 9.3.
\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

$$
\begin{split}
pOH = 14 - 9.3 = 4.7
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
\ce{Ca(OH)2 -> Ca^{2+} + 2\ OH-}
\end{split}
$$
$$
|\ce{OH-}| = 10^{-4.7} = 2 \cdot 10^{-5}\ M \Rightarrow |\ce{Ca(OH)2}| = \frac{1}{2} \cdot |\ce{OH-}| = 10^{-5}\ M
$$

:::
